title: Nice facility average service
text: I stayed for one night on business, and loved the location, the room design, and the European breakfast served near the elevators. For the price, the hotel is regal and a good value. However, as someone who is fortunate enough to regularly stay at boutique hotels on business trips, I found the aloof, detached relational-style of the front-desk staff to be a missed opportunity to make this hotel someplace really special. In Chicago, the James (for bigger budgets) or the Burnham (for more modest budgets) are better choices.
